title: Why is it hard for entertainers to break into the billionaire club? - Quora

response.answer_text: In the entertainment and music industry it is hard to get any little job at all. the idea of making big money is unlikely and a one in a million chance. Even Elvis never earned a billion bucks. There are two or three actors that have come close to making a billion bucks. Think about it. You probably can not drive one block without running into a kid who sings and plays guitar. There is a severe over supply. On the other hand a bassoon or oboe player might find orchestral work as there are very few oboe or bassoon players of high quality available.
Because an entertainer only has ONE product to sell, themself. To be a billionaire you have to have multiple products to sell or know how to invest and buy and sell various products.
